initialResearchSummary: Alright, my friend, so let‚Äôs take a stab at what this Moody Tunes site might be cooking up. Just by that catchy name and the URL vibes, I‚Äôm getting the impression it‚Äôs all about the music scene. Maybe it‚Äôs like a rad hub for discovering new tunes or artists that are flying under the radar. You know, the kind of place where you can stumble upon hidden gems that make you feel like you‚Äôre in on a cool secret. I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if it has some cool playlists or mixes curated by music enthusiasts. Picture scrolls of smooth jazz, upbeat indie tracks, and those chill lo-fi beats perfect for studying or just chilling out. And let‚Äôs not forget the classic ‚Äúvibe check‚Äù playlists that hit just right when you‚Äôre trying to set the mood for a laid-back evening with friends or a solo night of introspection. Then again, if they‚Äôre going by the name "Moody Tunes," I could see them playing up that emotional side of music too. You know how some songs just vibe with feelings? Maybe they‚Äôre curating tunes that really get into the nitty-gritty of human emotions‚Äîhappy, sad, hopeful, or even angry. The kind of tracks that just resonate with where you‚Äôre at in life, making you feel understood without even having to say a word. And hey, if they‚Äôve got a blog or articles on there, I can totally visualize posts breaking down the latest trends in music or spotlighting up-and-coming artists. You know, interviews with musicians, stories about their creative processes, and maybe even some behind-the-scenes peeks into the music industry. That kind of stuff is always a hit and connects fans to the artists on a deeper level. Also, they might have a community vibe going on with forums or discussion boards where fellow music lovers can share their recommendations, talk about concerts they‚Äôve been to, or debate the best albums of a certain year. Just a bunch of folks coming together over a shared love for music, swapping stories, and bonding over their favorite tunes. If they‚Äôre really savvy, maybe they‚Äôve got some features like music discovery algorithms that help you find new stuff tailored to your taste. Kind of like when Spotify figures out what you‚Äôre into and feeds you those perfect tracks, but with a more personal touch. That would be super cool! Overall, I get the feeling that Moody Tunes is like your chill friend who always knows the best music to put on during a hangout, the one who can read the room and throw on a tune that makes everyone smile or gets them lost in thought. It‚Äôs probably a digital space where vibes are high, music is celebrated, and everyone can kick back and enjoy the sound of something beautiful together. So, whether you‚Äôre in it for the discovery, the community, or just to get lost in the vibes, Moody Tunes sounds like a place where music lovers can gather and geek out over all things sound-related. researchResults.content: ¬≠ Hidden gems: the 11 best festivals of 2025 Navigation Skiddle.com Profile ¬ª News and Features ¬ª Hidden gems: the best festivals of 2025 Hidden gems: the best festivals of 2025 Starting the year on a high, we've rounded up some of the best festivals of 2025, expanding your festival knowledge like never before. Check it out now! Shares Skiddle Staff Last updated: 13th Jan 2025 In 2025, we are taking a new and fresh approach with some gems to start your year on the right note. With up-and-coming bands, DJs and comedians already out for your enjoyment, we are giving you the chance to expand your festival knowledge like never before with the best festivals of 2025. Spanning across a multitude of genres, scroll down and check out to see which ones you‚Äôll want to be at this year. Beyond The Valley (BTV) Photo: Beyond The Valley / Facebook.com When: Sunday 28th December 2025 - Thursday 1st January 2026 Where: Barunah Plains Homestead, Victoria, Australia If you want to go to a pretty cool festival where you feel like you‚Äôre time travelling with or without some special help then you should know more about one of Australia‚Äôs musical pride of joys; Beyond the Valley. Located in Barunah Plains Homestead in Victoria it‚Äôs the perfect location for those post-Christmas and NYE celebrations across 4 days. Since 2014, BTV has been bringing some huge names to their stages, including, Tyer the Creator, Bicep,Peggy Gou, Central Cee, Mall Grab and more. And of course, this year is no exception as they have Ice Spice, FISHER, and Imagine Dragons as headliners, plus Barry Can‚Äôt Swim, Sammy Virji, Confidence Man and more in their gleaming lineup. Displaying their strong love for the musically talented across all genres from, dance, hip-hop, indie, electronic and more it's an easy choice when adding it to the list of the best festivals of 2025. Open‚Äôer Festival Photo: Open'er / Facebook.com When: Wednesday 2nd - Saturday 5th July 2025 Where: Gdynia-Kosakowo Airport, Gdynia, Poland Open‚Äôer, Poland‚Äôs largest and most musically diverse festival, is a cracking choice. Despite how huge and well-known it is over in its home country, there‚Äôs a solid chance you might not have heard about it yet. Since 2002, the festival has attracted punters from all over who are keen to enjoy a lineup spanning rock, indie, pop, hip-hop, dance, and more. For this year's bash, they've already confirmed Linkin Park, Massive Attack, Brutalismus 3000, Caribou, FKA Twigs, JPEGmafia, Justice, and more will be performing. Plus, the drinks are cheap, there‚Äôs a beach nearby, and it‚Äôs an incredibly well-organised do. 2000trees Photo: 2000trees / Facebook.com When: Wednesday 9th - Saturday 12th July 2025 Where: Upcote Farm, Cheltenham, England Winner of Best Medium Festival in 2022 and 2023, 2000trees is, for sure, one to keep an eye on. If you love heavy tunes, head over here to tear up the pit with around 15,000 other live music fans. Boasting relatively cheap tickets, that buzzing, welcoming atmosphere, and hard-hitting lineups, the ones who know about 2000trees remain loyal followers. Go for mostly emo, punk, rock, and metal; this year's big names include Kneecap, Paris!, Taking Back Sunday, Coheed and Cambria, and Alexisonfire. Find more information on 2000trees Lost lands Photo: Lost Lands / Facebook.com When: Friday 19th - Sunday 21st September 2025 Where: Legend Valley Thornville, Ohio Feast your eyes on one of the most jaw-dropping EDM festivals in America. Lost Lands is a beast when it comes to production with its huge main stages featuring volcanoes. Displaying more than 100+ dinosaurs around their campsite, some of which you can ride, Lost Lands has no issues feeding strongly into their prehistoric theme, especially with their location adding to the effect. Enjoy a weekend filled with more than just music as they also have yoga workshops, music workshops, live painting, immersive environments and more, it‚Äôs simply one of the best festivals of 2025. Plus for those who don‚Äôt want to end the party early, Lost Lands also has a Late Night Sounds Camp, where you can witness some breakthrough DJs display their genius and a few special B2Bs. With the lineup TBA they've always delivered with previous years featuring some of the best bass music artists in the game from, DJ Snake, Boogie T, Camo & Krooked, Delta Heavy, Ahee, Lady Faith, and Dirty Monkey just to name a few. Breezing into their 8th year of epicness, get a load of Lost Lands this year. Mighty Hoopla Photo: mightyhoopa.com When: Saturday 31 May - Sunday 1 June, 2025 Where: Brockwell Park in London Crowned as one of the best UK pop festivals and a fabulous extravaganza, let us introduce you to Mighty Hoopa. Welcoming a crowd of 30,000 people, Mighty Hoopa is a festival that brings in a diverse group of people and every year with a lineup that always reflects that. With their high encouragement of the LBGTQ+ community, they welcome new and established acts from across all spectrums to bring the fun to London‚Äôs Brockwell Park. With the choice to choose between bathing in the sun with some fizz or dancing the night away, with the help of 200 artists across 10 stages, including Ciara, Pixie Lott, Kate Nash, Jojo, Loreen, Vengaboys and so much more, you couldn't really ask for more! Find more information on Mighty Hoopla EXIT Festival Photo: Exit Festival / Facebook.com When: Thursday 10 - Sunday 13 July, 2025 Where: Petrovaradin Fortress In Novi Sad, Serbia, in Novi Sad Exit this way (literally). Get a load of Exit Festival, one of the biggest techno festivals in Serbia. Created out of liberation in 2000, as a student movement, Exit has flourished into an absolute force to be reckoned with as an award-winning festival. Set on the banks of the River Danube, Exit Festival offers a diverse range of music and entertainment for you to experience. Offering stunning views like no other while you listen to 600 artists from, Eric Pyridz, Hurts, Loreen, Ti√´sto, Ki/Ki, The Boomtown Rats, and more across 20 stages, ranging from rock to indie, electronica and a heavy focus on techno this is one of the best festivals of 2025. This is the kind of fairytale experience you‚Äôll never forget. Find more information on EXIT Festival Down The Rabbit Hole Photo: theboohooguide.com When: Friday 4th - Sunday 6th July 2025 Where: Groene Heuvels in Beuningen, The Netherlands Getting a bit zany with it, Down The Rabbit Hole goes down by a huge lake, and is all about adventure and surrealism. A place where you can walk up to a stranger and have a chat in-between moments of excellent live music, it has a bit of a cult following for a reason - it‚Äôs one of the country‚Äôs best festivals. Go down the Rabbit Hole in 2025 for unusual art, community, and sets from top-notch artists including Sam Fender, Massive Attack, Iggy Pop, FKA Twigs, Patti Smith, Beth Gibbons, Tems, Ezra Collective, Maribou State, Viagra Boys, Japanese Breakfast, and more. Manchester/Edinburgh Psych Festival Photo: Manchester Psych Festival / Facebook.com When: MCR - Saturday 30th August 2025 / EDI - Sunday 31st August 2025 Where: multiple venues in Manchester, England / multiple venues in Edinburgh, Scotland Celebrating the more weird and wonderful sounds emanating from the indie scene, Psych Fest returns to Edinburgh and Manchester this year. The festival takes over some of the coolest venues in the cities, showcasing psychedelic music and arts. Both cities have Deadletter, Honeyglaze, Crocodiles, George Clanton, Bubble Tea and Cigarettes, and more to look forward to, with more artists being announced soon. Brought to life by immersive production, it‚Äôs about to get trippy‚Ä¶ Find tickets for Manchester Psych Festival Cross The Tracks Photo: Cross The Tracks/ Facebook.com When: Sunday 25 May, 2025 Where: Brockwell Park in London In our list of the best festivals we have a known favourite amongst the jazz community and that's no other than, Cross The Tracks Known as Brixton's #1 soul, jazz and funk festival, Cross The Tracks festival is an unmissable festival that offers you a day filled with major festival production. Decorating its stages with huge names over the years, Cross The Tracks is not afraid to push the boat out and this year is no different. So far on their lineup are some incredible talents including, Michael Kiwanuka, Jordan Rakei, Shae Universe, Jaz Karis, JGrrey, Channel One and so many more. So get yourself down to one of the biggest events in South London and embrace the fresh air amongst the festival landscape of the luscious Brockwell Park. Find tickets for Cross The Tracks FLY Open Air Festival Photo: FLY Open Air Festival / Facebook.com When: Saturday 13th - Sunday 14th September 2025 Where: Princes Street Gardens, Edinburgh, Scotland One of the best festivals in Scotland, FLY Open Air is heaven for electronic dance music fans. While we‚Äôre sure a few of you will be familiar with FLY, we still feel it deserves more love. The festival takes over a UNESCO World Heritage site, where Edinburgh Castle creates the backdrop, as some of the most in-demand international DJs take to the decks. We don‚Äôt have a lineup for 2025 yet but last year saw PAWSA, Marlon Hoffstadt B2B Malugi, sim0ne, SOSA, Josh Baker, Max Dean B2B Luke Dean, Hayley Zalassi, Dominique., and loads more tearing it up. Go for forward-thinking beats across multiple genres, a fantastic crowd, and stunning sights. Find more infomation on FLY Open Air Festival Lost Village Photo: Lost Village / Facebook.com When: Thursday 21st - Sunday 24th August 2025 Where: near Norton Disney, Lincolnshire, England Festivals are about escapism, right? As well as the music, of course, but you can‚Äôt beat that feeling of having no responsibilities as you run around causing havoc with your mates. So Lost Village, a festival deep in the forest, will always be a shout. LV invites you to wander the abandoned forest, navigate the trees, pass derelict buildings, and head deep into the woods to meet new friends, dance to the best DJs, and indulge in unreal food. Get stuck into talks, workshops, comedy, and wellness, then get lost in the music. We don‚Äôt have a lineup for this year just yet but 2024 saw sets from The Blessed Madonna, Solomun, salute, Sherelle, Horse Meat Disco, Ben UFO, Habibi Funk, DJ Seinfeld, and loads more. And there you have it the best festivals of 2025, courtesy of us! With a wide range of festivals across not just genres but the world, giving you loads of choices on where to expand your music taste. For festivals, lifestyle events and more, head on over to our Things To Do page or be inspired by the event selections on our Inspire Me page. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information. #### Performance Cookies Performance Cookies These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance. #### Functional Cookies Functional Cookies These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly. #### Targeting Cookies Targeting Cookies These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. [Privacy Policy](https://maplemedia.io/privacy/?dsar_url=https%3A%2F%2Fprivacyportal.onetrust.com%2Fwebform%2Fc86e34a8-8ec1-4049-8c12-f734ced17f34%2Fa6ddece6-12dc-4d1e-b23d-cdc9dc83086c%3Freferer%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fplayer.fm%252Fpodcasts%252Fhidden%26source%3DMastodon%26env%3Dprod%26site%3DSite_PlayerFM) Allow All ### Manage Consent Preferences #### Strictly Necessary Cookies Always Active These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information. #### Performance Cookies Performance Cookies These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance. #### Functional Cookies Functional Cookies These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly. #### Targeting Cookies Targeting Cookies These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising. ### Cookie List Clear checkbox label label Apply Cancel Consent Leg.Interest checkbox label label checkbox label label checkbox label label Reject All Confirm My Choices [![Image 473: Powered by Onetrust](https://cdn.cookielaw.org/logos/static/powered_by_logo.svg)](https://www.onetrust.com/products/cookie-consent/)
